content: purchase you can use a paper clip or hair pin or my fave which is just a plastic tapestry needle with a short length of contrasting yarn attached easy to insert into the stitch and remove when necessary the little length of contrast yarn provides enough friction so the marker doesn t slide out until you re ready gauge 7 cluster sts = 4 4 repeats of 1 round of cluster st plus 2 rnds of single_crochet = 4 2 | p a ge abbreviations used note american terms used in this pattern chain chain cluster st cluster stitch double_crochet double_crochet round s round s single_crochet single_crochet slip_stitch slip_stitch st s stitch es links to helpful tutorials are provided on the last page of this pattern begin pattern crown of hat increases note this hat is worked in the round from the top down throughout the entire hat you will not turn your work unlike increases in most crochet hat patterns which are worked from the top down not every round in this pattern is an increase round therefore this creates a gentle curve to the top of the hat 1 chain 3 1 double_crochet in the 3rd chain from the hook if you re new to crochet use your stitch marker in this 1st double_crochet so you ll be able to easily differentiate this double_crochet from the chain stitch then double_crochet 11 more times in the same stitch you now have 12 total double_crochet stitches plus the remaining chain 2 remove the marker from the 1st double_crochet join with a slip_stitch in the top of the 1st double_crochet the beginning chain in this round and all other beginning of round chains in this pattern will not be counted as a stitch use a marker in the 1st stitch of each round this marked stitch will the one in which you will make your join before beginning the next round 2 ch1 beginning in the same stitch as the chain 2 single_crochet in each stitch around removing your marker as in round 1 join with slip_stitch -
